tool.name: RNA Centric Annotation System
tool.command:
R -e 'library(RCAS);
library(data.table);
library(GenomicRanges);
library(topGO);
runReport(queryFilePath = "$input_BED",
gffFilePath = "$input_GTF",
msigdbFilePath = "$human_msigdb_gmt",
annotationSummary = $run_anot,
goAnalysis = $run_GOrich,
msigdbAnalysis = $run_PATHrich,
motifAnalysis = $run_motif,
genomeVersion = "$genomeVersion")'
&&
mv *RCAS.report.html RCAS.report.html

param.name: input_BED
param.label: Target regions in BED format
param.help: The coordinates should be in accord with Genome Version.

param.name: human_msigdb_gmt
param.label: Human Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB)
param.help: The database is usesd for pathway enrichment. For non-human species, the human MSigDB will be automatically converted accordingly.

param.name: run_anot
param.label: Run annotation.
param.help: Use this option if you want to run annotation.

param.name: run_GOrich
param.label: Run GO term enrichment
param.help: Use this option if you want to run GO term enrichment.

param.name: run_PATHrich
param.label: Run pathway enrichment
param.help: Use this option if you want to run pathway enrichment. If so, please provide path to msigdb.

param.name: run_motif
param.label: Run motif search
param.help: Use this option if you want to run motif search.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Purpose**
RNA Centric Annotation System (RCAS) automatically generates dynamic annotations for custom input files that contain transcriptomic target regions. RCAS automatically summarizes annotated features that overlap with targets in the BED file, and perform enrichment analysis of motifs, Gene Ontology (GO) terms and gene set.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
1. A target region file in BED format 2. A reference annotation file in GTF format 3. A Human Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) (optional)
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
The main outputs of RCAS are:
1. Annotation Summary for Query Regions 2. motifRG analysis results 3. GO Term Analysis Results 4. Gene Set Enrichment Analysis Results
The summary of annotated features consists of intuitive reports in terms of distributions of gene types, genomic features, gene names and coverage profiles. RCAS can provide users list of motifs that are enriched comparing with background sequences. In addition, RCAS generates lists of enriched gene sets and functions to shed light on the functional aspects of target regions. The final report of RCAS consists of high-quality dynamic figures and tables, which are readily applicable for publications or other academic usage.
**The final report is provided as a HTML file which can be saved and viewd via a web browser.**
